Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_set_filter_preference

The function AIL_set_filter_preference sets the value of the specified filter-level preference.

void AIL_set_filter_preference(
  HPROVIDER filter,
  char const * name,
  void const * value
);

In Parameters

filter
specifies the filter to set.
name
specifies the name of the preference to set.
value
specifies an address of the 32-bit value that will be set. The type of the data that this parameter points to should match the "type" field in the RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY structure returned from AIL_enumerate_filter_attributes.

Discussion

Filter-level preferences are preferences that are set globally for particular filter. For preferences that are specific to each sample (sample-level attributes), use the AIL_set_filter_sample_preference function.

This function sets the value of a preference. To retrieve the current setting, use the AIL_filter_attribute function.

Example files that use this function: Filter.CPP


Group: Digital Filter Services
Related Functions: AIL_enumerate_filter_attributes, AIL_filter_attribute, AIL_set_filter_DLS_preference, AIL_set_filter_sample_preference, AIL_set_filter_stream_preference
Related Basic Types: HPROVIDER, char const *, void, void const *
Related Structures: RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY
